meanings.definition: A mistake in grammar or usage.
meanings.sent1: She made several solecises in her essay, confusing the readers.
meanings.sent2: The teacher corrected the solecises in the students' homework.
meanings.sent3: The solecises in his speech made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her writing was full of solecises, like a minefield of errors.
meanings.sent5: The solecises in the document were as glaring as neon lights.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake in grammar or usage.
meanings.sent1: He often solecises when he rushes through his writing.
meanings.sent2: Please proofread your work to avoid solecising.
meanings.sent3: She solecises so frequently that it's become a running joke.
meanings.sent4: His tendency to solecise is like a broken record, repeating the same errors.
meanings.sent5: The student's essay was marred by his inability to stop solecising.
